content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution to your problem. In Julia, you can use the Dates package to work with DateTimes. The function `yearmonth` gives the year and month of a DateTime object as integers.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this column are the year and month of each DateTime in the `dt` column, concatenated into an integer format "yyyymm".
